main event: Multiple witnesses reported a silver-tipped object with trailing smoke moving slowly across the sky in Watertown, New York on May 11, 1949, before slowly disappearing and seeming to dissolve from the tail forward.
interesting points: The object was described as similar to a silver ball, and seemed to reflect the sunlight rather than being illuminated by its own source.
Multiple witnesses including a mother, her son, and others observed the phenomenon.
The object left a trail of light smoke which gradually thinned out and disappeared as the object dissolved.
The visibility that day was excellent with no clouds present to obstruct the view.
Two separate incidents were reported, each with their own set of details and observations.
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including a mother, her son, and others
